Reviews.Title: Really like this Camera
Reviews.Author: Diana "Hans Mom"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few weeks now and I really like it.  In fact I like it better than my digital SLR for the most part.  I purchased this because I am a mom and I like to take pictures of my kids when we are out.  It really isn't practical to haul an SLR to the park, Disney, etc.  So I did a lot of research and went with this one.  I love that you can watch the pictures in HD on your TV. It takes good video for a camera (not really an issue for me because I have a video camera.  I am very impressed with the overall picture quality.  Also the camera has tons of modes to take pictures in and my favorite feature of the camera is that you can crop the picture right there on the camera.  Finally, I love that these cameras come in colors it helps make the camera standout so you don't forget it or get it confused at parties.  Anyway I am very impressed so far.  I only gave it 4 stars because I haven't had it that long.

Reviews.Title: Ok but not the best
Reviews.Author: PinsandNeedles
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and returned it the next day.  My dad had bought a Casio Exilim z80 so i tested both side by side.  First, the casio is smaller and lighter than the kodak which makes it feel better in your hands.  As for picture quality, they both were fairly similar, however I would have to say the casio was a tad bit better.  When the pictures were enlarged, the casio's images were less pixalated looking.  The kodak's video recording was what really shocked me.  I took the same video with both cameras.  The casio's video was amazingly clear.  The kodak on the other hand was horribly grainy looking.  I also had a ceiling fan running during both videos.  in the kodak video you could hear loud air blowing sounds but the casio didnt have that.  another cool thing about the casio is that you can take a picture while recording a video.  Both cost about the same and are both 8 MP.  in my opinion, check out the casio exilim z80 before the kodak m863.  hope this helps :)

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: M. Ambruch
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  We purchased it as a gift for our 19 year old son and we were all very impressed with the clarity of the pictures and relative ease of use.  I have a Kodak DX7590 which I very much like (especially for the 10X zoom, but am so impressed with this little camera, have purchased another one for myself to keep keep with us all of the time. Just waiting for it to arrive. I also like that it comes with a battery charger, I have seen some similar models that only charge through a USB.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Carolyn "mystery mama"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good little camera for the price.  I like the size which easily slips in a pocket.  The resolution is decent and you can crop pictures quite a bit without it looking too pixelated. It is easy to download the pictures and the features on the camera are plainly marked.  The only problem I have is that it has no viewfinder and it is hard to see the screen in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: Italy Photos
Reviews.Author: A Reader
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer and I don't like cameras with too many features.  This camera is easy to use and takes fabulous pictures with the simplest Auto setting.  I turned off the flash and left it on the Auto setting all through my Italy visit and came back with the most amazing pictures.  The shots impressed professional photographers (not only because Italy itself is picturesque beyond words!).  I also got a few one- or two-minute video clips which played beautifully on my computer.  The camera is small and thin and fits in my little purse.  I dropped it a couple of times and nothing happened to it.  I recommend this camera wholeheartedly to all who travel (or not).

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Amy Hann
Reviews.Content: It is very satisfactory and has fun options right there in the camera. So if u just like to take pictures for the fun of it and like to customize your photos, this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: An okay camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Chris "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I am giving this camera 3 stars because the 'right arrow' on the circle pad stopped working after 3 months. Otherwise this is a really nice camera.Pros:- Easy to use menus- Feels very solid in your hand. Well made.- Focuses quickly and takes pictures quickly- Takes great 5 megapixel photos!- Screen is large and clear- Includes the kodak easy share software- Cool color!- Fits nicely in your pocket or purse. Perfect for vacations.- Video recording works quite well.- When taking vertical shots the screen automatically adjust the image so that it is not horizontal. This is a VERY nice feature! Not sure what that feature is called but it's cool. :) Pictures stay right side up when you copy them to PC as well.Cons:- 'Right arrow' key on the navigation pad stopped working at 3 months.- 'Left arrow' key on the navigation pad is really hard to press because of screen size.- You absolutely cannot see the screen during bright sunlight.- Doesn't do so well on night pictures. Has trouble focusing and takes very grainy pictures. I was so unhappy with my Vegas pictures!- Pictures are a bit grainy at 8.2 megapixel but it of course doesn't affect your prints. Who actually views pics at 8.2 anyway?- Viewing screen scratches easily. I recommend a protective cover.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended- power problems
Reviews.Author: Tamara Hatch
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this digital camera. I purchased it in late 2008 and have used it a few times. I've been careful to keep the battery charged. It recently began to malfunction and cannot be repaired. The camera turns on for a second, but then immediately powers off again. Switching to a new battery does not help; nor does removing the memory card or attempting to operate the camera on AC power. In short, the camera is useless. I searched online to find troubleshooting information and found dozens of people having the same problem with this camera. It's too bad, because it took good photos.

Reviews.Title: MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT!!!
Reviews.Author: Busy Mom
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed : (  I bought this camera to take pictures of my kids. Unless your kids are perfectly trained not to move an inch when they see a camera & your house is professionally lit, I can't see how you would be satisfied with this camera. I took pictures in every different scenario imaginable and used all the different settings. The outside pictures of landscape turned out beautiful! Every other picture was grainy and/or blurry. If your into scenic photography this camera can't be beat for the price, but your planning on taking pictures of live people or animals look elsewhere. I even called Kodak and was told they have had ALOT of complaints about grainy/blurry pictures with this camera. They're advice was to try a couple of different settings for taking pictures of the kids & to "make sure you hold the camera perfectly still to avoid blurry pictures". Anyone else out there able to get a 2 year old to sit still & hold a pose while you try not to move a muscle & still get a decent picture? I've decided this is not the camera for me, so I'm sending it back. I've had a 5MP Kodak camera for the past 3 1/2 years and have had no problems until recently. I just don't think they make things like they used to even 3 short years ago. This is the second camera I've purchased to replace the old one, it's also the second disappointment. I'm not an expert photographer by any means, but to me, point & shoot means POINT & SHOOT. It doesn't mean point, change every setting imaginable, turn on 12 more lights, strap your kids in a highchair to make them sit still, then freeze yourself (except one finger to push the button), and then shoot. MAJOR LET DOWN!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: CrystalJean
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading the reviews, and saw some were less then thrilled with their camera. After purchasing it, I can say, "This is great!". It takes fantastic pictures in the dark and in the middle of the day. The zoom option is fantastic and the stabilization option couldn't be better. I even took some pictures while I was in a moving vehicle and I saw no blur and it was really clear. I'd defiantly recommend this camera to anyone who was considering buying it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Quality Wins Every Time
Reviews.Author: Michael London "2004"
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a lot of camera for the money.  A true value.  Many advanced features, yet all are easy to master.  Exceptional photographs.  The camera has a quality "feel" about it,  as you might expect of Kodak Company.  The camera has more style than the rest, and the compact design was a surprise.  So it is easy to carry to sports events, family gatherings, kids outings, whatever.  Bottom line:  It will be hard to beat this camera. Purchase with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Still exploring my new camera
Reviews.Author: Feifer "Feifer"
Reviews.Content: So far I have really enjoyed the camera.  There are so many settings and I have not figured them all out just yet, but I am sure once I do then I will like it even more.  I have enjoyed taking pictures and videos and using the software that came with it to enhance the pictures.  The camera is small enough to take along but not too small to hold and steady. I bought a 2GB SD card and have 1272 pictures and 44 minutes of video at the highest quality setting.  So far I have recorded a school play, two award ceremonies and taken many photos from near and far in all light conditions.  I do not have the steadiest hands and there is a built in stabalizer that helps with that.  Overall I am very pleased and feel that the camera was well worth the money and I wish I had gotten it sooner.

Reviews.Title: lasted 1 week
Reviews.Author: D. Snyder
Reviews.Content: This looked to be a good product in the reviews.  The camera worked for about a week and then it appears the unit does not stay on and could not get the zoom to return.  I saw another review posted a few days after I made the purchase here with the same problem.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: E. Champney "E.C."
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking it would be a good product because it was Kodak. WOW was I wrong. The photos are totally out of focus and the videos were pretty sucky. I even thought it may have been a lemon, so I exchanged it. With no luck, same crappy images. Don't waste your money on this camera it sucks.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE Indoor Pictures
Reviews.Author: Donna D. Kinzie "azqdee"
Reviews.Content: I am not one to usually write reviews on products, BUT becuase I am so incredibly disappointed with this particular product, I feel its my duty to warn other unsuspecting shoppers out there!This camera takes absolutely lovely pictures - as long as they are outside.  Any pictures taken indoors are of such poor quality that my camera on my cell phone takes better!!  I have tried all the differnt settings and features that the phone offers to see if I can get a better picture and its just not possible on this camera.  After only 9 days and over 250 pictures later, I am taking it back today!

Reviews.Title: Can't see LCD in the sun
Reviews.Author: Steve0
Reviews.Content: Just bought this camera and took on a trip out of the country.  It's nice and small and light, so fits in a pocket easily.  Unfortunately, however, it was very tough taking pictures in the outdoors with the camera, as I really couldn't see what was being shown in the LCD screen due to the bright outdoor lighting, and lack of a viewfinder.  Total bummer, as a few of my pictures had the key points of interest cropped on the side since I couldn't frame the shot.  Picture quality, etc., otherwise was fine.

Reviews.Title: Kodak does not stand behind their products/ I do not recommend this camera
Reviews.Author: lot4my$
Reviews.Content: I have owned akodak camera for 13 months, I have gotten about 3 months use out of it.  Kodak is notorious for freezing up.  I sent it in twice and it comes back the same way.  Now 1 month passed warranty the Kodak supervisor say's it's not his problem and they will not stand behind their products.  It doesn't matter that it is the same ongoing problem because it is 1 month passed the warranty date.  I would suggest you purchase a sony they rate much higher and the customer service is much better.  These cameras work great for about 1 month then you can pitch it in the garbage.  Good luck if you buy it.

Reviews.Title: Mother's Day Gift.
Reviews.Author: Rebecca A. Decker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my mom. It is very easy to use and it comes with nice editing software.

Reviews.Title: Buy the warranty!
Reviews.Author: T. Matuzak
Reviews.Content: We've had to return this for a new one already.  The problem is that once the camera is charged, it will only hold a charge for a few days.  So if you get out the camera quickly to capture a magical moment--surprise!  Nothing happens--nothing.  It has to be charged for an hour.  THEN, you have to reset the date and time (the camera does not seem to permanently store this.) We did buy the warranty, and I'm about to return it.  Caveat emptor...

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Divonne
Reviews.Content: I absolutely hate this camera. I have had this camera for 2 months now and all of the pictures have turned out grainy. Now, there is a purple haze on all of my pictures. Kodak did not help rectify the problem, so I am done using Kodak products. I noticed that some reviewers were able to take decent pictures outdoors, but all of my pictures were of poor quality. I am certain that it is not due to "operator failure," but due to poor craftsmanship. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. This camera has proved to be a waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: Buy the warranty!
Reviews.Author: T. Matuzak
Reviews.Content: We've had to return this for a new one already.  The problem is that once the camera is charged, it will only hold a charge for a few days.  So if you get out the camera quickly to capture a magical moment--surprise!  Nothing happens--nothing.  It has to be charged for an hour.  THEN, you have to reset the date and time (the camera does not seem to permanently store this.) We did buy the warranty, and I'm about to return it.  Caveat emptor...

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Divonne
Reviews.Content: I absolutely hate this camera. I have had this camera for 2 months now and all of the pictures have turned out grainy. Now, there is a purple haze on all of my pictures. Kodak did not help rectify the problem, so I am done using Kodak products. I noticed that some reviewers were able to take decent pictures outdoors, but all of my pictures were of poor quality. I am certain that it is not due to "operator failure," but due to poor craftsmanship. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. This camera has proved to be a waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: Not The Greatest.
Reviews.Author: nettie
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take to China with me so I could remember everything I did and saw there. It worked fine the first 4 weeks, then on the 5th week the lens part wouldnt come out right or go back in at all. I was frustrated, especially since I was on a trip and couldnt have it fixed right away. I sent it back in when I got home and had it fixed. After that it worked fine, then started up with the lens thing AGAIN so I sent it back again asking if they could replace it ( I thought it was just a dud) and they did. This camera worked fine until a week ago when the screen started shaking crazily when I turned it on and now its completely blank and wont let me see the pictures I take. Although when this camera worked, it took great pics and was really clear, its just not one that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Mizz Sevilla
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement for an older version that didn't survive a dip in the sink (it was actually our fault and not the kids'!).  I didn't want a camera with too many buttons and functions, as I use it to take pics of the kids and need to point and shoot quickly before I lose the shot.  I haven't had any issues with the camera.  It's worked wonderfully from day one.  The change from replacing batteries to re-charging it was a great new feature, as was the simplification of the wheel (though I see they've gotten rid of it completely on the newest version).  We're considdering this for a gift for my mil, who is hopelessly stuck on her film camera and has minimal computer skills.  I do have to agree that bright sunlight ruins your view on the screen, but I found it to be that way on pretty much any digital device.  I believe most buyers looking for a good digital camera to invest in will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: No Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: M Tracey "M. Tracey"
Reviews.Content: This camera may be good if you never take a picture outdoors.  There is no viewfinder to look through.  Outdoors, any natural light will make seeing what your trying to take a picture of impossible.  The LCD screen reflects a fairly good mirror image of your face.  So it may be good to adjust your makeup but not much else.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Justin Leitner
Reviews.Content: i had received this camera as a gift a few years back.  After extensive use i can say that this is a good product.  Its small and compact.  It takes nice pictures for personal use.  Its battery also holds up pretty well and charges fairly quickly.  I have yet to have any real problems with this product.  It is actually really user friendly compared to other cameras that i have had in the past.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare is easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Cherie Eifler
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera.  I'd gotten another model for my husband a year ago, and I finally decided to come into the digital age.  Neither of us knows much about this technology.  This camera is easy to use...even for us, and the pictures are pretty awesome.  I'd recommend this camera for anyone who is learning...and the price is terrific compared to others.

Reviews.Title: Outside pictures? A joke
Reviews.Author: JayKay
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a battery problem with double AA batteries on another camera. Battery is fine but as stated in other reviews, you can't see anything on the screen to take a picture with if you are outdoors.  There is no viewfinder to aid you either although I always use the screen. All I could see was an image of my face in the lcd screen  and I just had to guess, point and shoot and hoped I got what I was aiming towards. Not good at all. I am going to return it! What good is it if you can't see what you are aiming towards? I would not recommend this at all!

Reviews.Title: Very decent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Howell
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a camera for the last few months for a upcoming trip, and managed to find this one for cheap. Most 8MP cameras usually go for about $100+ bucks, so paying nearly half that was a steal.The camera itself is very lightweight and small, about the size of a credit card and about the same size as a man's wallet. I'm not a expert photographer, so my main goal for this camera was to get decent pictures and video for a low price.The camera itself does a decent job of taking pictures with decent amount of sunlight, although it does start to have issues when going into darker areas. The good thing is there are multiple modes to reduce blur and take pictures in different climates (Snow, Beach, etc). The interface is easy to use, and does not require much thought on the user. You can also adjust the picture quality so you can take more pictures, although any mode below 6MP looks pretty bad.Storage is very limited on the camera, so you can only take a few shots before the internal memory is full (about 10MB, which is barely enough for 10 8MP shots, and 40 1MP shots). SD cards are a must, with the 1GB SD card being able to store about 870 8MP shots.The video quality is decent for a camera this cheap. You can either do 320 x 240 mode with 30FPS or 640 x 480 with 15FPS. Either way, the video is usually pretty decent and is at least youtube quality. On a 1GB SD card, you can store about 20 minutes in 640 x 480 mode, and 30 minutes  in 320 x 240 mode. If you are looking to do a lot of video, a 8GB card might be recommended.The downside of the camera is the build quality. The mode wheel at the top feels a bit cheap and hard to move, and the SD and battery card cover makes me feel like it will break at any moment. The USB type it uses is exclusive to Kodak cameras, so buying used might be a problem if you do not get the cable. The battery is a rechargable one, but it does not support any other battery types so you cannot just put new ones in on the fly.Overall, the camera was very decent for the $56 I paid for it used. You can download the PDF and drivers from Kodak's site if you are buying used, but make sure you at least get the USB cable or charger.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed with this camera
Reviews.Author: L. Kollman
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if I received a bad camera or not but about 1 month into using this camera, the flash didn't seem to be working properly.  All of my photos were either very dark or overexposed even though I had it on Auto Flash mode and the flash appeared to be going off.  I sent it in for repair once (it was under warranty but I had to pay the shipping charges). It was returned to me stating it was fixed but I still had the same problem.  This was so frustrating as this was my only camera and I was missing key moments in my kids' lives.  I sent it in again and this time they seemed to fix the flash problem but I spent far too much time talking to customer service about this. Even with the flash fixed, I still feel that pictures were blurry and not crisp.  Also, it is impossible to take a picture outdoors in bright sunlight- you cannot see anything in the LCD screen (there is no viewfinder) so you have to guess if you are taking a good picture.  I ended up getting a Canon Powershot A590IS and I am so much happier.  I would not recommend this Kodak camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Robinson
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome for the price. Takes wonderful pictures (that I take daily) and when you get them printed out at a photo center, they are amazing. Very happy with this camera. Large screen and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Camera
Reviews.Author: Bonita Vorachek "Bonnie Vorachek"
Reviews.Content: This product was a gift.  Recipient loves camera.  Overall, this is a great product and the service was exceptional as well.  Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: vicki
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 9 months and just bought one for my 12 year old daughter.  Great pictures, easy to use features.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Jimenez
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday and it works great. I'm just using it for general picture taking, but the pictures I have taken come out nice and clear. I love it and I recommend it to anyone who is interested in just simple picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M863
Reviews.Author: Gabriel S. Mayers
Reviews.Content: The camera takes too long to recover between photos and if you want to take a few quickly--forget about it! Other than that, not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: new camera
Reviews.Author: ph "ph"
Reviews.Content: worked really well at first, but now my images are getting rather grainy, but i am sure it is probably something I am doing. My fav thing is the fact you can download all your pics at once, and then email ALL of them at the same time, instead of having to download each one individually!

Reviews.Title: Super awesome!
Reviews.Author: Draven Shayde "GreenSnake"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. it's probably the best compact camera I've ever owned.  I recommend it for anyone who is looking for a good camera for casual picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Albert Simms
Reviews.Content: I am truly enjoying the use of my new camera and will recommend it to all of my friends.It is easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: waste of money!
Reviews.Author: B. McKee
Reviews.Content: The average review for this camera should be NO stars!!! Not only did we have the same problem that everyone else has (it works for about a week, then the lens stops staying open), but there are MANY reviews here that say how bad this camera is, yet it show as "4 stars".  You have better odds of winning in Vegas than having this camera work for you. Don't risk it!

Reviews.Title: don't bother
Reviews.Author: Elspeth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and it only worked for a week or so.  Then the camera started not powering up (that is, the lens opened then closed right away.  I tried a new battery which didn't work, and I put it aside. Big mistake. Now I don't know if it's under warranty, and I barely got any use out of it. I wouldn't recommend this camera if there are going to be issues right away.  There are much better comparably priced cameras.

Reviews.Title: Happy kodak man
Reviews.Author: David F. Renken
Reviews.Content: The kodak m863 is a great camera and i could not be happier with the camera and the prompt service i got with my order. Thanks

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Capital One "boy elroy"
Reviews.Content: this camera takes great pictures,and is compact. the only problem with this camera is it takes 10 to 15 seconds before you can snap another shot. i would definately recomend buying another camera if you have to take pictures quickly. i did not return it because their was a restocking fee.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Logan "Cory"
Reviews.Content: For the price I really enjoy this camera. It is compact and very functional with plenty of options for me (although I don't have much knowledge about cameras). I found it very user friendly and at 8.2MP with a 4GB SD card, it has a picture capacity in the thousands. My only problem with it is that you can't view pictures/videos without turning it on and extending the lens. If there was a way to view pictures without extending the lens, this would be a perfect camera.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: J. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed the camera.  It fits in my purse and is easy to figure out.  I like that it was sold with the memory stick; saved me time and energy.  The price and shipping was right and it came in the time that was posted to come.

Reviews.Title: Blurry pictures indoor - no matter what
Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: I have faced the very same problems listed in most reviews. The worst one is the blurry pictures indoor. There is no way to work around this no matter what you do with the light, distance, ISO settings, .... I have sent mine for repair 3 times already, and got a replacement, which is as bad as the original.I wish I had read some of the negative reviews before I bought this camera. I also bought it because I had good Kodaks in the past.

Reviews.Title: don't buy Kodak
Reviews.Author: Albert
Reviews.Content: I've bought a Kodak M883 it's a 8 mega pixels camera. the Picture I've taken all came our blur my Nokia camera Phone picture which is only 1.3 mega Pixels came out much better than Kodak M883.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Christina N. Shelton
Reviews.Content: The camera came on time and it was easy to set up.  The picture quality is very good and it even adjusts to when you take a vertical photo.  All of the different photo settings are a nice feature.  The only problem is sometimes it won't stay turned on.

Reviews.Title: Problem with Sound
Reviews.Author: Techmom "www.BabySproutNaturals.com"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 2 days ago while on a trip out of state. I bought it to replace another easyshare camera (V803) I lost just the other day.What I LOVED about this camera was:* Ease of use - menu navigation and controls* Easier to hold onto not as slippery* Fantastic and large LCD screen!* Great shots - not blurry like my other Easyshare V803* Fantastic videoMy V803 always froze on me to where I'd have to remove the battery. If I took pics of my kids they were ALWAYS blurry. I even had the camera serviced 3 times in the first year I had it and it still froze on me.But the MD863 took FANTASTIC shots! And I was impressed with the shutterspeed.Only one major problem. The camera made a very high pitched noise when the LCD screen was on. When I recorded video the noise was amplified. The high pitched noise would stop when the LCD screen went off to conserve battery power. Called Kodak and they said I could send it in for repair but with my unsuccessful repair history with the other camera I am going to choose to return it to Walmart instead. I don't want to have to wait weeks for it to get fixed for one, and 2 I don't have a lot of faith that they will actually fix the dang thing. Kodak should just give you a new one when these things happen.If I cannot get another one (same model) that works, I think this will kill it for me and Kodak. I know they are one of the best brands out there but if I cannot get any luck with 2 different Kodak camera models then I'd be stupid to purchase it again. It's true, hardward just isn't made like it used to be.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Cam!
Reviews.Author: Gwen
Reviews.Content: This camera was exactly what I was looking for.  It has a built in battery for easy recharge, simple to use, and compact to make it easy to carry. It has multiple settings for photos, and takes a great shot. A definite buy for anyone who wants a quality, affordable camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Castle "Cat Lover"
Reviews.Content: This was given as a gift.  My mom loves it.  She is not very tech savy but had no problems learning how to use this camera.  Great for beginners.

Reviews.Title: love it!!
Reviews.Author: K. M. Chovan
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Its small and light. Takes great piture's. Will recommend for other to buy if you like Kodaks. The only camera I use.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Lisa R. Bush "LRBush"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new Kodak camera; after much research I thought this was what I was looking for.  I love that the LCD is larger and that it has 8.2MP.  Though I purchased this in June; I haven't had time to learn how to use the features, I've only taken aim and shot pictures.  I am somewhat disappointed that there seems to be a delay when taking the picture and that my initial object has moved - thus creating a blurred picture.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Eightballwilly
Reviews.Content: Camera is small enough to easily fit into most any pocket. A big plus when on vacation riding roller coasters. This little camera took a lickin and kept on tickin. Battery life was excellent. Took pictures all day and recharged at night to be ready for the next day. It took beautiful pictures and the videos were also surprisingly good.  I have two small negatives. First, it would be nice to have an eye piece to look through especially in bright sun because the screen washes out. Second, in anti-shake mode the pictures seem a bit grainy to me. Not that much of an issue unless you do a lot of zooming when you shoot.  A very nice little camera for the money. The saying "any picture is better than no picture" is so true and this little camera makes it easy to get those pictures that might otherwise be missed.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Solek
Reviews.Content: Great little camera that is very easy to use and has excellent picture quality.  Good battery life with a large lcd view finder.  This camera also offers a multitude of exposure options.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easyshare Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Chirico
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift to my college student Daughter. It is very easy to use. She is very happy with it. I recomend this camera for any age it is simple to use and the photo quaility is great.

Reviews.Title: stay  away  from  Kodak  bad  image  quality
Reviews.Author: Linda D. Thames "linda d. thames"
Reviews.Content: i  bought  this  item  2  weeks  ago  and  i  printed  an  8x10x11  picture  and  it  was  very  cloudy  and  it  has  lines  in the  pictures  and  in  the  camera  also.  i  also  printed  a  4x6  picture  and  it was  terrible  it  had  lines  all  in  the  picture  i  said  to  my  self  i  am  never  ever  buying  a  Kodak  again  so  i  bought  a  canon  power shot  sd750  and  it  takes  amazing  pictures  no  i  would  not  reccomennd  this  camera  to  anyone

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Happy Shopper
Reviews.Content: I am a HUGE fan of Kodak cameras and this was the 3rd digital Kodak I purchased and I only bought it because my V530 stopped working after two years. I was so in love with that one I thought this was going to be a wonderful upgrade. Wow was I wrong! I only used this for one weekend and I am sending it back, no matter how I change the settings the pictures turn out grainy. My other 5mp camera was so much better. I just ordered the Olympus Stylus 840, all reviews for that one were great and I am hoping to have better luck with that one.

Reviews.Title: don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: D. Godbey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a month ago and the first that I got was defective so I sent it back. The screen was messed up on that one. Got the second one used it for about 2 weeks and now it won't turn on. Called Kodak to troubleshoot told me the battery was dead, like that wasn't the first thing I thought was wrong and tried. It wasn't the battery needless to say. So I am returning this one as well. I will not be getting another Kodak anytime soon. I am very disappointed with the quality of this product. I would not recommend this to anyone unless you want a big hassle.

Reviews.Title: This camera doesn't work for me
Reviews.Author: S. Melendez
Reviews.Content: this is the worst digital camera I had ever!!! I bought it because my Sony Cibershot 5.2 megapixeles needs AA batteries and they don't last too much, so I decide to buy a new one with li-ion battery. What I say is awful is the picture quality. If you use it with natural light and no zoom it is ok. It works perfect. But if you use zoom or with flash, they are horrible. Look like if you use a cell phone. They look so grainy that it doesn't work for me. This camera may be useful for someone just for fun but not for someone who need to take pictures of maps, figures, close up in nature, etc. Even though the camera style is nice and the  battery life is fantastic, it last almost 1 month!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Alfreda N. Teagle
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, I decided to buy this camera.  It is the best decision ever.  This is my first digital camera and I couldn't ask for anything more from it.  It takes awesome pictures and records great videos.  It is easy to use and easy to transfer the pictures from the camera to your computer.  My favorite part is the rechargeable battery.  I plug it up to recharge when ever I think about it and my low battery light has yet to come on.  I have had it for about a month.  We have to buy my husband one now because he is trying to steal mine.

Reviews.Title: marginal quality
Reviews.Author: S. Finlayson
Reviews.Content: I am a bit disappointed by the quality of this camera.  The shutter delay is a bit too long.  After about two weeks of use, it started shutting down immediately after being turned on.  Mailed it to a camera repair shop and hope the warranty covers it (supposed to).  Haven't received it back yet.  A few more dollars buys a substantially better camera: bought a Casio Exilim last week, with which I am much more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera--as long as it is working!
Reviews.Author: J. Amos
Reviews.Content: I bought my M863 in July 2008, and loved it. After 11 months, mine started acting up. It was turning on, the lens coming out, but then closing and powering off. I could go into review mode and look at the pictures on the camera though. After going through the online troubleshooting, was told to send the camera in to United Camera. After more than 3 weeks and not hearing anything, I contacted them. The response was that there is corrosion in the camera and that the corrosion voids the warranty. Everything that I read said that dropping or exposing the camera to liquid voids the warranty (which did not happen), and the battery was a Kodak internal rechargeable battery. If corrosion was from the Kodak battery, then this should be covered by Kodak's warranty. I contacted Kodak about how unhappy I was with this and that I know that the camera could not have had corrosion. They told me that they stand by United Camera's claim. After being a faithful Kodak Digital camera customer for more than 9 years, I just bought an Olympus yesterday. So unhappy with the poor customer service I received from Kodak and the shotty claim that United Camera gave me.

Reviews.Title: This is the worst camera I've every owned
Reviews.Author: R. Krupa
Reviews.Content: My daughter received this camera for her birthday in July.  We had to return it in September for repair, again in November for repair and now two months later it is broken again.  Amazon won't refund or replace and I get nothing but run around.  Terrible product and terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: kodak digital camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M. Derowitsch "Jonathan Derowitsch"
Reviews.Content: As I learn on this camera, it does seem to be fairly simple to use.I'm sure as time goes along, I will learn more about it. It's small and easy to use and the pictures do come out very clear. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a simple camera to buy.

Reviews.Title: red camera
Reviews.Author: wanda k sipes
Reviews.Content: Thank you for asking.So far, I really like the red camera.  Haven't had time to get pictures processed. Wanda Sipes

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Camera
Reviews.Author: Patti Burd
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  This is my third one in 9 years.  I never have to buy a battery for it.  It recharges on the computer! and that saves me a lot of money on batteries!  It arrived on time & it was just as the seller listed it.  No problems. Great deal. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Miriam Ibarguengoitia
Reviews.Content: I had a camera like this one since several years ago. I have other two cameras that are excellent too and even more up-dated than this one. However, this camera not only takes excellent pictures but also it prints the date all the time once it is programmed to do it. In contrast, the other cameras only print the date picture by picture, previously programmed each time. I like to get the date in each picture because this is a useful information that helps me to compare and to analyze content of pictures. Recently, I lost my  beloved camera. Then, I looked for the same and I found it. Therefore, I am happy again.

Reviews.Title: THE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Nancy Veronica
Reviews.Content: I AM GLAD I GOT THE CAMERA, ASI HAVE ALL THE ATTACHMENTS.....THANK YOU  THIS IS THE BEST LITTLE CAMERA TO CARRY AROUND

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Attempting Amazon
Reviews.Content: This is the first used purchase I've  made and I will be more careful in the future. The camera screen was scratched badly and the camera needs charging all the time. Not what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Used for many years
Reviews.Author: Jonny
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. I've had one for at least 5 years. I'm not as easy with it as I was when I first got it. After all these years, I'm confident it can hold up to a beating. It's even been under water in a hot tub. Once it dried out, worked fine again. Takes good pictures and I bought another one just to use at work.

Reviews.Title: upgraded from an upgrade..
Reviews.Author: lily_dragon_2007
Reviews.Content: i have always liked Kodak so when i got my camera (8 months ago) i was excited. its sleeker, smaller and more durable then the camera i had before. i got my camera home and much to my dismay i couldn't get the share button to work i tried everything but my computer just wouldn't sync my address book with my camera and the video was really grainy and noisy (even on a day with no wind it sounded like there were gusts of wind) on the plus side the Li-Ion battery saved me multiple times from having to change out batteries in the middle of taking pictures with my family and friends. i love my camera and it takes AWESOME pictures i just wish i could get the share button to work. I'm looking forward to upgrading again soon and hopefully i can get the share button to work on the next one :)

Reviews.Title: Great transaction
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this purchase.  Seller was swift in mailing out product.  I would do business with this seller again.  Had this exact camera and dropped/broke it.  All I needed was the camera and none of the accessories; which is exactly what I found on Amazon.  Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: been a GREAT camera
Reviews.Author: Steven N. Garofalo
Reviews.Content: My old Kodak died after 5 years so I bought this one... it's really easy for my elderly mother to work, it was pretty close to the old one we loved.I bought the Easy Share Camera Dock ( an extra cost accessory but well worth it to me) so I just set it on the dock next to my computer screen, and it starts to charge. it's always charging and ready to go. when I want to take the pictures off the camera and onto the computer I just press the button on the camera dock. As soon as I press the button on the dock  all the pictures go onto my computer stored in a folder with today's date on it.The pictures are CRYSTAL clear truly amazing quality I print them out or print calendars and the pictures are always GREAT. .... it's really easy to use... but without a view finder it's impossible to take pictures outside when the sun is up.... I really wish it had a view finder.As for using the video I would never use it for the video part.. I just wanted it to take pictures... so I have no idea about the video quality.. bet it's not too good in a  camera this size.I had it for a few years used it all the time and took it on several vacations....loved it so much I wanted another for my mom's purse. I could not buy it new ( they stopped making that model) so I bought a refurbished one... it took terrible grainy pictures so I sent that back and will hope the next one is like the other. now that I read about half the peoples camera's dying after a year I'm a little scared. but I'll say mine has been PERFECT for three years. And I doubt I'll ever buy a refurbished again.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Reyes
Reviews.Content: This camera works great, takes great photos. The first one I had I dropped so bought the exact same one. The quality of the pictures is great compared to other cameras we have in our household.

Reviews.Title: Money well spent
Reviews.Author: eharton
Reviews.Content: I had previously owned one of these and knew it was a good product.  I had no idea buying one referbished would be so worth my while! Seller was very friendly and made sure I was satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Reliable and Student Friendly
Reviews.Author: Chelsea DeChaos
Reviews.Content: I've had digital cameras for about ten years now, and I must say my M863 is my favorite (close runner up is the C743 that I broke, which I also ADORED). I trust Kodak as a brand, I've never had a total lemon (minus my mom's Z1285). I've beaten mine up since early August 2008 and I've yet to be totally disappointed. I've really abused this camera, it's gone everywhere I have (gotten slightly wet on occasion) and thrown at multiple things, it's never once skipped a beat. If it ever glitches you pull out the battery and it's perfect again. You can't go wrong with this camera!Pros - Easy to use- Fits in any pocket- Slim design- Fast start up- Great battery life- Decent pictures outdoors- Great pictures indoors (with proper lighting settings)- Zoom during video is digital (no noise reduction!)- Decent video when not using digital zoom- Optical zoom is strong and does not create blurry and out of focus pictures or video- Takes LOTS of abuse in your pocket, purse, or bag and will keep kicking.Cons - You MUST be mindful of the settings you're using- Digital zoom in video mode makes the videos horribly pixelated- Digital zoom in general makes images look horrid- Certain settings make the camera freeze up a bit, you need to have a fully charged battery in order to really enjoy the night time options- Any slight obstruction and the flash becomes rather useless to the picture (common thing though)- Digital stabilization doesn't do as much as you'd think it would, but still useful.- Any kind of stabilization is only present when you use the flash- Red-eye flash can sometimes make the camera rather slow to respond

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: mlcolussy
Reviews.Content: I just love my camera.  I take it everywhere because I can fit it in my pocket.  It is so great to be able to take photos whenevr and where I like because it is with me!

Reviews.Title: DON'T install the Kodak software! DO buy some memory!
Reviews.Author: Alun Whittaker "AlunHW"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little camera but following the setup instructions that came with it, almost led my wife to send her gift back in disgust. These instructions tell you to install the software CD onto your computer before plugging in the camera to a USB port. If you do this, you will be burdened with a bulky, clumsy, barely usable User Interface/Web UI with the sole purpose of selling you additional Kodak products and services and, in the process, preventing any other, more useful program from getting access to the camera driver for viewing or downloading images. Trust me, this software makes iTunes seem sleek, and unintrusive!After struggling for hours with the Kodak software, the included manual, the downloaded User Guide, the downloaded "Extended" User Guide, and the online tutorial, we gave up and did what we should have done in the first place. We uninstalled all of the supplied software, re-booted, and plugged in the camera again. And yes, Windows 7, recognized the camera, located and installed the necessary driver and offered us a selection of access methods for viewing and downloading pictures, using our own software, such as PhotoShop Elements, PhotoImpact, Windows Photo Gallery, and Media Player.You also need to know that the available "barebones" memory of the camera holds no more than a dozen pictures. To avoid a disappointing gift experience, you should add a card with a couple of gigabytes of SD memory (or microSD with an adaptor) to be plugged in as soon as the camera is unwrapped.

Reviews.Title: Good. While it works.
Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday, and it worked exceptionally well. I was in love with it because of the ease of use, the wide pan shot, and the seamless transition from camera to computer without any sort of issues.While it worked.Not even a year after I received it, it no longer worked. I was very careful with the camera. I didn't drop it, didn't expose it to any sort of liquid, and handled it gently. I was a general user with no extraordinary needs from the camera. One day, the battery drained very quickly and the camera shut off. Thinking I just needed to recharge it, I did so. The camera never turned back on. Not completely any way. It pretends to for about a second before shutting off again. Thinking it was a battery issue, I had it checked to make sure I didn't just need to purchase a new battery. The battery was fully charged. I made numerous attempts to get it to work, from bringing it back to the store (to have them tell me it would be cheaper to buy a new camera than get this one repaired) to visiting the completely useless Kodak site whose best suggestion to solve my problem was for me to put the battery in the right way. Right. Thanks a lot for nothing.My suggestion? Do not buy this camera if you want a digital camera that will last you more than a few months.

Reviews.Title: great camera except for the fact that it never works:(
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera about a year ago. i used it all the time, it worked great. but after a few weeks, it didn't turn on, so i sent it to get fixed. a few weeks after that it stopped working again. it wasn't just mine. my brother and sister also got the same camera, but in different colors. they have had the same problems as me.

Reviews.Title: Horribly grainy
Reviews.Author: kaytayxo
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera I have ever owned. After a month of having it, the firmware got damaged and had to send it back. Upon getting it returned, the pictures were worse than before. No matter where you take your pictures, they will always be grainy. It is very poor in low light conditions, and even worse in daylight.I do not recommend this camera at all.

Reviews.Title: DO Not Buy
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement to my Canon 4MP digi and it failed miserably. Going back to Canon for the rest of my life. My new Canon SD790IS is AWESOME.

Reviews.Title: You don't have to spend a lot to get a great camera.
Reviews.Author: Lou Michaels
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Kodak M863 digital camera and I couldn't be happier with it. It is easy to use and takes very good pictures. I have one very small problems with the camera. The user manual could have a been a little more informative. Not to worry though, you can get all the information you need on Kodak's web site. They also have a great support team . They can be contacted via the telephone and you actually get a real person to answer all your questions. This is a great little camera and for the price you can't beat it. Buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Horribly Grainy
Reviews.Author: flowthrough
Reviews.Content: I bought the first Kodak series digital cameras in the 1990's - when they were only 1 megapixel.(Have used Film SLRs previous to that- and owned a few digital cameras since)- just to preface this review with my experience level.Stay away from this camera. It gives horribly grainy photo results- and generates jpeg file sizes that are half the size of my Canon S550 (which is only 5 megapixels- yes file sizes vary based on subject matter- but not by a factor of HALF the size- when the megapixels are much greater). Went through the manual- online help, and phoned Kodak. Confirmed manual quality settings for sharpness, High color, ISO, 8.1 megapixel, and aspect ratio- and still.. marginal/poor image quality. Confirmed- it is not a lighting issue either.You'd think an 8.1 megapixel camera from Kodak would yield good photos. Well.. think again. I wish I bought something else and didn't waste precious memories with this crummy camera.

Reviews.Title: One of The best I have Ever Purchased
Reviews.Author: H. Gress
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera up to replace a Canon sd100 that I absolutely could not stand and let me tell you I have owned some really expensive cameras and this little camera stood right up there with them,I don't have one bad thing to say about this camera. It took EXCELLENT Pictures and EXCELLENT video. The pictures were so clear and all you had to do was just press the button.  It took the pictures that fast to. I was extremely please and impressed with this little Kodak.

Reviews.Title: DEAD
Reviews.Author: F. cowell
Reviews.Content: I had this camera 14 months and it worked great.  One day last week it wouldn't turn on.  All it did was pop the lens out and then  right back in.  I did some research and found this is a common problem with this model.  Called Kodak and they told me to pound sand.  Just a word to the wise.  Avoid this camera...

Reviews.Title: Most Expensive Disposable Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: Miss Priss "non-fiction lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought my camera in October 2008 and used it 3 times (Halloween, Christmas, this spring).  It was on my shelf the majority of that time with no exposure to any elements.  This Halloween I take it out and it didn't work.  Out of warranty I contacted Kodak basically to be told that I'm SOL and that for $70 I could send the camera back to them to go toward a new Kodak product.  I hope they enjoyed the $100 they got for this camera because they won't get any more of my money.

Reviews.Title: Gotta be something better
Reviews.Author: carlson4saka
Reviews.Content: This is the second kodak digial camera I have owned.  Purchased this one in January and it already is 'acting up'.  The first one worked for a year and a half and just quit without warning!  I used to really recommend this camera, but won't anymore and neither will the others I've suggested it to.  The lens must be extremely sensitive as sometimes it comes out for a picture and other times it shuts off.  I won't buy another one like this.  I depend on my camera for pictures of girls, I don't have time to worry if this will 'decide' to work today.  The warranty is bogus.  But the time you pay for the warranty, send it in, you could buy another one.  I guess things are made to be disposible!  Frustrating!  I think we had only one camera the entire time I was growing up - it was a Pentex - so I will look at that next time!

Reviews.Title: So much fun
Reviews.Author: K. Nelson "Solo"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak cameras are so simple and so much fun and I love that they are innerchangable on the printer dock

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Sheppard "J Shep"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes nice pictures, is fairly easy to use, has a spectacular large display.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera, definitely not the best for the price
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a little over a year ago to get better pictures of my son. I previously had a 3 mp Nikon camera, and sadly, my old camera took better pictures that this one. I have to take 5 shots of each picture because most of my pictures come out blurry, despite having the antiblur feature on. A friend of mine has a Sony Cybershot, which she bought at the same price, and the quality of this camera doesn't even come close to hers. I'm disappointed I didn't read more reviews before buying this camera. It does take pictures, but unfortunately, half of the pictures in my son's photo album are slightly blurry and not nearly as clear as they could be had I researched more and bought a higher quality camera. It's a compact, colorful camera, but doesn't take high quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Horton "CowboyLH"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after I had broken my Kodak SLR. I was wanting something that would take great pics like my old camera, yet be small enough to carry around. I, of course got both with this camera. Very big viewing screen and the camera itself is very durable. I say it is durable because I had dropped it outside and couldn't find it. I found it a day later under 3 inches of snow- three hours later (after drying out) it fired right up and was ready to go again. Great camera, great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Red Kodak digital camera
Reviews.Author: A. Tippens
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh! The entire family loves this camera! I love the way that it takes pictures and videos. It also have song tags which you can put songs to a picture! I purchased a pink digital camera from Office Max but I gave it away to someone who really liked and wanted it. I loved that camera and I couldn't find another one at Office Max so I searched Amazon and lo and behold I found this one and many more that I liked. Amazon have a vast variety to choose from.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Carl D. Porter "Author"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. The wife wanted something small, dependable, and easy to use. This fit the bill nicely.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Emikandairwaves
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Best Buy the day after X-Mas. I got the last one, and I got it for an incredible price, including an extra battery, carring case, and 2G chip.The pictures are always very clear, even when youre moving. My brother was head banging, and the picture was still clear! I was so surprised!The only down side is that when you take video, the letter "S" makes you sound like you have a lisp.I love this camera, and take it everywhere I go. I was definatly not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: T. A. Nelson "TAN"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my camera just before Christmas and love it.  Like another reviewer, I had problems with the majority of my pictures having a grainy look especially when I transferred them to a PC.  This was resolved by going to Kodak's website and obtaining help via their live chat session.  With the camera in Auto mode press the Menu button and go to the 2nd camera icon (with the + sign).  Arrow down to ISO Speed and select ISO 800.  I took a picture, transferred it to my PC and the image was very clear (no grainy look).  I'm not sure if this is a permanent save. You may have to do this each time the camera is turned off.

Reviews.Title: Memory card mandatory
Reviews.Author: C.Natalia Dillon "Carpe Diem"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera it is just the right size because i did not want something that was too bulky. I am not quite technologically savvy so I was not aware of the need for a memory card with the purchase of this camera. I did not immediately purchase a memory card which is mandatory with this product so i was not able to get alot out of it without a memory card. Overall quite satisfied it is my very first camera.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Sweets Galore
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much for this camera. It's in great condition and works great! I love it! It was fast delivery also!

Reviews.Title: Kodak digital camera
Reviews.Author: Edmund W. Vizinas
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time.  Very easy to use. Holds a charge well and takes good point and shoot pictures with ease.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Entry-Level Camera
Reviews.Author: Connecticut Consumer "John"
Reviews.Content: Prior to purchasing this unit, I did a fairly exhaustive internet search of user-reviews of entry-level digital cameras. Since this is my first digital camera, the most important factors for me were ease-of-use and overall user-friendliness. On both those counts, I can say the unit performs remarkably well.  My wife, who is very much a non-techie, has had no trouble using the camera for taking pictures of her eBay merchandise.  Clarity and resolution are very good. And the camera interfaces fairly seamlessly with the included Kodak software and Kodak Gallery.  Battery life also seems remarkably good. It would have been nice, though, if Kodak had included even a simple cloth carrying case.  The only reason I didn't give the camera five stars was because of the difficulty viewing subject matter outdoors with the LCD viewfinder, especially in bright sunlight.  The glare makes it almost impossible to see your subject.  In fairness, though, this seems to be a problem with LCD viewfinders in general, not just Kodak's.  But overall, it's a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera! Ordering 2nd one today!
Reviews.Author: C. Lucas
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  I have one that I bought about 6 mos. ago and I am getting ready to buy a 2nd one.  My husband uses the 1st one all the time and he likes it because its compact.  I like it cause I can carry it around in my purse and use it whenever I want.  It takes awesome pictures....I haven't had but a few pictures that didn't turn out...but that was me taking a crappy picture.  This will be my 4th Kodak camera. I don't know what people keep talking about the LCD screen being hard to see...In certain lighting conditions ALL camera lcd's are hard to see.  I have Canon Rebel XSI and it's the same problem.  If the light is really bright and/or really dim they are all hard to see at times.  This doesn't bug me. Its just a known fact that this is problem.  It really disturbs me that people give it a bad rap for just that problem.  The bottom line...It takes really good pictures and its easy to use.  Thats all that really matters to me...

Reviews.Title: Good Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: Molly R. Solomon "Molly"
Reviews.Content: This camera works really well. I have not had any issues with is since purchasing it a few months ago. Its compact and the battery lasts a long time. You can charge it with a USB to AC adapter using the camera cord, which is nice. The lense can take some pressure on it as that tends to happen, no issues with scratching. All around good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Decent budget camera. Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: D. Hentze
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera for a gift for a 9 year old girl, so it had to not be a toy, easy to use, good quality, and stylish to her. The pink M863 fits the bill. It takes decent pictures. It seems well built. The functions are well laid out, and easy to use. She has no problem downloading the pictures to her computer with the EasyShare software. She is very happy with it. Judging from the results of pictures taken in various conditions, it seems to take good, but not great pictures under most circumstances. All in all, it's a good camera for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M863
Reviews.Author: Tim R. Mcknight "ryan22134"
Reviews.Content: Very small, just what we were looking for.  My wife can keep this in her purse so we can take pictures anytime we like.  We had a larger Kodak camera for a couple of years now but it is not convenient to carry with us all the time.  If your looking for a compact camera to carry on the go, this is the one!

Reviews.Title: Cool little camera
Reviews.Author: Gamerashell "G2"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I like to take candid shots.  You know the ones where nobody is expecting the picture and then they're all yelling ERASE THAT!  And I am very pleased that this camera makes those pics possible.  Unlike other digital cameras that tend to flash for five seconds before taking the picture I can go ahead and click away and capture the moment, whatever it may be.  The screen is hard to see in darker places like bars or dimly lit restoraunts but is usually able to be viewed after pic is taken thanks to the awesome flash. It has a pretty god face recognizer on it but I honestly don't have a reference of comparison.  It also has quite a bit of options for picture taking including a two-to-three shot panoramic mode.  I wish it came with a case but that's about the only real complaint I have.  I keep it on 5 mega pixels for the pictures and they come out looking amazing and it allows around 2000 pics on a 2GB SD memmory  card.The zoom feature is nice but when it gets into the digital zoom arena it gets pretty choppy.  Not much of a complaint their though as the normal zoom goes in pretty deep.All in all if you want a camera to take out and just take fun pics with you can't really go wrong with this one. It has great quality and timing and I've always trusted Kodak cameras.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M863 - A great travel camera
Reviews.Author: Nomadic1
Reviews.Content: While this camera doesn't have everything, it packs a lot into a little package for a great price. I needed a small camera on a recent trip to PR. I got some great pics. My only beef which I listed in the con section was that the LCD screen turns into a mirror in bright light. I just pointed in the general direction and managed to get great pics anyway.Pros:Small size (fit in shirt pocket), image stabilization, good battery life. LCD screen makes an awesome mirror in bright light (see cons). Excellent price for and 8+ megapixel camera especially when compared to models of similar size and features. 18 scenes available for different picture situations. HD Stills and digital image stabilization. Panaromic stiching of three sequential pics. Kodak is always very user friendly and very easy to use right out of the box.Cons:No view finder just LCD screen. Can't see LCD screen in bright sunlight, only a good reflection of yourself. No rapid sequence pics like some other kodak models of similar size.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Ajay
Reviews.Content: I've only had my camera a few weeks but it's been great so far. It's a huge improvement from the 2mp camera I had. It's small enough to fit in my pocket which was what I wanted it for, and it has sound themes to choose from so that's kind of fun. The face detection is kind of cool. Only thing I'm unsure about is the zoom. It doesn't seem to zoom in very far and when you do zoom all the way in, the picture looks very grainy, on the screen at least. It may not come out that way when printed. I don't know. I'm happy with my purchase though. It's a good camera for the casual picture taker.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Content: love it, it is very small and light which is great for in a pocket

Reviews.Title: very good product
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Peek
Reviews.Content: So far have enjoyed using this camera. Have had no problems and it is a good camera.

Reviews.Title: This kodak is the Best !
Reviews.Author: Steven Hales
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kodak for my wife but I ended up using it about half the time, We took in on a recent Street Rod Tour and I am a complete DUMMY when it comes to photography . This thing is easy to use with automatic adjustment easy to read menus and turn the little dial on top for settings. The pictures came out real good. If I had a speck of criticism it would be the difficulty seeing the in the view window when the sun is shinning , But, that happens with all digital cameras . The price is right and the quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: Okay.
Reviews.Author: jenni
Reviews.Content: I really like Kodak cameras, but the second day I had this I saw that the screen had already been scratched. The scratch on the screen is very annoying. Other than that, it isn't a bad camera.

Reviews.Title: easy to use, but didn't hold a charge
Reviews.Author: Anne M. Degener "amd"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 12 year old- it was eeasy to use and very enjoyable for taking photos and video, but on the 4th day, we found it would not re-charge. I bought a new battery for it, which did not solve the problem. I wanted a camera that we could recharge and not have to continue to feed AA batteries. I don;t know what was wrong. Otherwise we loved it. We ended up returning it and getting a different camera.

Reviews.Title: it was defective
Reviews.Author: N. Wootton "Amaryllis"
Reviews.Content: The camera took pictures just fine, but it refused to retract the lense when turned off. I sent it back to Amazon for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera So Far
Reviews.Author: N. T. Evans
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera in November (2008) and so far it has been a great camera.  Battery lastes long.  It is easy to operate.  The software is the best...even better than the Canon software from my wife's camera.  I wanted to support an American company (with the economic conditions) so I bought a Kodak and have been very pleased.  I recently took it to a reunion and was so surprised at how clear the pictures came out. you could read the name badges on the people being photographed.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: W. E. Loftis
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd Kodak, and it lives up to its name. This is easy to use and small enough for a purse.

Reviews.Title: Poor design
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in February 2009. In late November the camera stopped working. Shipped it off to Kodak's repair service "United Camera and Binocular Repair." Long story short, warranty repairs denied because of corrosion inside of the camera. ??? The camera did get a lot of use, however, it was never abused or exposed to excessive moisture (A few rain drops now and then...but thats it). I honestly expected this camera to last 5-6 years and when it died on Thankgiving afternoon I was a little upset that I was unable to capture any photos. I am even more upset that because of some design flaw that allowed moisture into the case, Kodak refuses to honor the 1 year warranty on this product.Because of only mediocre picture quality, I probably would not have purchased another Kodak, but couple average picture quality along with a failure to honor the product warranty, I will never purchase another Kodak product again.

Reviews.Title: Muy Buena Camara Digital
Reviews.Author: ENDERWIN "ENDERSIL"
Reviews.Content: La càmara es muy buena en todos los aspectos, portable, la baterìa le dura bastante, la calidad de las fotos es excelente, pero tiene algo en contra, el video es a veces pobre en lo que se refiere a los colores.. se necesita estar con mucha luz para que se pueda ver bien el video y de paso cuando existe luz excesiva, se pueden notar manchas de colores como un arcoiris.  Si no es por lo anterior le daria las cinco estrellas.

Reviews.Title: Shipment delay order not recieved
Reviews.Author: Zia Khurshid "Amazon India"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this on June 2nd using a Free shipping Promotion and Todayis June 12 and my order is still pending.After send 5 emails to Amazon don t care INDIA customer service andI get response that it will be ship in a week.What happen to Amazon USA?I will never buy anything from Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Content: in the sun you can't see the screen i think all cameras ned a veiw lens on them

Reviews.Title: BEWARE Does NOT Work With MAC LEOPARD Operating System!!
Reviews.Author: A. Daly "AD"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera and it's super cute, takes great shots but it is NOT yet compatible with the new MAC Leopard operating system.  The website says "leopard version of software comeing soon".  I downloaded the kodak package and everything.  When my shots would not upload I went to the kodak webpage and searched for Leopard and found it isn't quite there yet.  Too bad.  Now it's going back.

Reviews.Title: watch out
Reviews.Author: Colette Holbrook
Reviews.Content: Make sure you can buy the cartridge refill separately without being forced to buy the paper with it as I was with my G610 easy share camera and dock printer

ProductInfo.Features:
8.2-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
3x optical zoom lens, 5x digital zoom; HD still capture and VGA video
2.7-inch indoor/outdoor color LCD; in-camera charging using the included Li-Ion rechargeable battery
Digital image stabilization reduces blur; Face Detection locates faces and automatically adjusts settings
Compatible with SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M863 8.2 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom (Red)
